intro: Sedum triangulisepalum, commonly known as the triangular sepal sedum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats and is well adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are arranged in a triangular pattern, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in low-water environments.
